attributes.action: Revoke the legislation which makes the wearing of face masks compulsory
attributes.additional_details: In only March, Professor Chris Witty, the government’s Chief Medical Officer, told U.K. citizens that wearing a face mask had “almost no effect on reducing the risk of contracting the illness”.  He went on to say “wearing a mask if you don’t have an infection reduces the risk almost not at all. So we do not advise that”.  Therefore, we believe that making face masks compulsory is not based on sound scientific evidence and will have a significant negative impact on people’s mental health.
attributes.background: We believe, given the controversial and conflicting scientific evidence regarding the usefulness of face masks, that it is an infringement on our liberties to be forced to wear one in public.  Whilst we have no issue with them being encouraged, making it a legal requirement is unjustified.

You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in public places in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331174

Repeal the decision to implement compulsory face coverings in English shops: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331430

Make the use of masks on public transport voluntary and not mandatory: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325079

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support
